intro: Lomelosia sphaciotica subsp. decalvans, commonly known as the decalved lomelosia, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring slender stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests or along stream banks. Its flowers are typically small and inconspicuous, adapted for pollination by specific insect species. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
